item.title: More on visual learning and interactive visualizations
item.dc:creator: Sindhu Shetty
item.description:
In a previous post, I compiled some examples and resources on interactive visualizations. In this post, I am listing a few more that are quite interesting and useful.


Explorable Explanations


I am a fan of explorable explanations, the revamped site includes tools and tutorials to make your own explorables. Check out Nicky Case's post on the thought process behind creating an explorable explanation and Bret Victor's article on what it means to be an active reader. I recently came across Chalktalk which is like an interactive blackboard for exploring solutions by collaborating with the audience during presentations, read this article for more information.

item.title: Interactive Visualizations : Examples and Resources
item.dc:creator: Sindhu Shetty
item.description:
Recently, I came across the article Research Debt which talks about how increasing the effort in clear explanations can exponentially reduce the effort in understanding concepts and research work for researchers. I really admire visualizations that are made not just to impress, but to engage the readers and help them gain an intuition by exploring the concepts or methods from many different angles. I compile some of such examples here and also some of the tools that could be used to create such visualizations or web pages.
